text: :Not to be confused with Paseas, the Ancient Greek vase painter. Paseas (Πασέας) was a tyrant of the ancient Greek city-state of Sicyon in the 3rd century BC. He succeeded his son, Abantidas, in 252 BC. However, he was assassinated by Nicocles in 251 BC. Category:251 BC deaths Category:Year of birth unknown Category:Ancient Greek tyrants
title: Paseas
